title: Republicans Confront a Decision on Border Plan and Ukraine Aid
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Congress reporter Steven T. Dennis looks at what’s next on border legislation and aid for Ukraine. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Italy’s Finance Ministry Bids for Telecom Italia’s Sub-Sea Cable Unit
description: Italy’s Finance Ministry is offering to buy all of Telecom Italia SpA’s submarine cable unit Sparkle, an asset deemed to be of strategic value to the state.

title: John Podesta Is Replacing John Kerry as Top US Climate Diplomat
description: President Joe Biden is tapping veteran Democratic strategist John Podesta to be the top diplomat representing the US in global climate talks, succeeding John Kerry.

title: Trump Says He Would ‘Absolutely’ Block Nippon-US Steel Deal
description: Republican frontrunner Donald Trump said he would block Nippon Steel Corp.’s deal to buy United States Steel Corp. if he wins the November election, highlighting how the former president’s economic nationalism could imperil the sale.

title: Milei Wins IMF Approval for $4.7 Billion Argentina Disbursement
description: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board approved a $4.7 billion disbursement to the government of Argentine President Javier Milei, according to a person with direct knowledge of the matter.

title: Argentina’s Milei Plots Tech Summit With Tinder Founder
description: Argentina President Javier Milei spoke with Tinder co-founder Sean Rad on Wednesday, continuing to rally support from prominent tech leaders while members of congress kicked off debate on his biggest legislative priority.

title: Biden Officials Agree to Weigh Student Debt Relief Changes
description: The US Education Department agreed to hold another rule-making meeting over its proposal for an alternative student-debt relief plan after pressure from Democratic lawmakers and influential advocacy groups.

title: UK’s Hunt Warns Limited Room for Tax Cuts in March Budget
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt warned he has limited room for tax cuts in his upcoming budget, after Bloomberg reported the UK’s fiscal watchdog presented the Treasury with constraining numbers this week.

title: Why Biden Is Cracking Down on Bank Overdraft Fees
description: Consumer advocates have long complained that US banks and credit unions charge exorbitant overdraft fees to vulnerable customers. Pressured by the Biden administration’s financial watchdogs, the biggest banks have taken voluntary steps to reduce their overdraft fee revenue in recent years. But the White House wants to go further and is proposing restrictions that could make a more significant dent in the billions of dollars that big banks generate from overdraft fees.

title: Steve Schwarzman Among Wall Street Donors to Christie’s Failed White House Bid
description: Blackstone’s Stephen Schwarzman and Pershing Square Capital Management’s Bill Ackman were among the Wall Street donors who underwrote former New Jersey Governor Chris Christie’s unsuccessful campaign against Donald Trump for the Republican nomination.

title: Zuckerberg Gives Impromptu Apology at Child Safety Senate Hearing
description: In an unscripted scene during tense testimony Wednesday, Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg stood before a packed Senate hearing room and apologized directly to the families of children who were victims of sexual exploitation on social media platforms.

title: BRICS Gets Boost as Saudi Arabia Joins Group of Emerging Nations
description: South Africa’s foreign minister said Saudi Arabia and four other countries have accepted the invitation to join the BRICS club of nations that was extended during a summit last year.

title: Ukraine Tells Allies Troops Are Outgunned Three-to-One by Russia
description: Ukraine has warned its allies that it is facing a “critical” shortage of artillery shells with Russia deploying three times as much firepower on the frontlines each day.

title: Coinbase and Its CEO Prep ‘War Chest’ for Pro-Crypto Politicians
description: With two of his most-formidable competitors in prison or likely headed there soon, Brian Armstrong has emerged as arguably the most-powerful leader in the digital-asset industry. And his ascendancy comes at an intriguing time: the start of campaign season for a US election that his company has described as “the most consequential in crypto’s history.”

title: Peru Says Machu Picchu Protests That Stranded Travelers to End
description: A protest that had disrupted access to Peru’s Machu Picchu ended on Wednesday, after local authorities reached an agreement regarding a new ticketing system, the government said.

title: Republican Senators Explore Stand-Alone Ukraine Aid in Reversal
description: Key Republican senators are exploring dropping demands for new border restrictions and backing a stand-alone emergency aid package for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan.

title: US Disrupted Chinese Hacking Operation That Targeted Routers
description: A court-authorized operation had disrupted a Chinese state-sponsored hacking operation in which spies hijacked a large network of devices in the US, officials from the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the US Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

title: Political Rammies: The Readout With Allegra Stratton
description: Today the big political moves aren’t happening in Westminster.

title: Russian Manufacturing Booms With Economy on War Footing
description: Russian industry expanded for the third straight year in 2023 as the government’s spending on its prolonged war on Ukraine helped counter the impact of sanctions imposed by the US and its allies.

title: Meta, X, TikTok CEOs Ripped by Senators Over Child Online Safety
description: Leaders from five social media platforms were admonished by lawmakers at a US Senate hearing to discuss child online safety, which began with videos and testimony from people who say they were sexually exploited on X, Facebook and Instagram.

title: India Court Opens Up Part of Disputed Gyanvapi Mosque to Hindu Devotees
description: A Hindu group secured a court order to perform prayers inside the premises of a centuries-old mosque in the Indian city of Varanasi on Thursday, days after Prime Minister Narendra Modi consecrated a controversial temple on another site where a mosque once stood.

title: Erdogan to Visit Egypt to Reboot Ties After Decade-Long Friction
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan will visit Egypt next month in a bid to restore ties after more than a decade of fractured relations, according to Turkish officials familiar with the matter.

title: Who Is Phil? Warrington Man Turns PMQs Into Economy Debate
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: UK Plans to Ease GB-N. Ireland Trade Flows to Restore Stormont
description: The UK set out its plans to ease trade frictions on goods flowing between Great Britain and Northern Ireland, a key demand of the Democratic Unionist Party in exchange for rejoining the region’s power-sharing government.

title: Russia and Ukraine Resume Prisoner Swaps After Crash
description: Russia and Ukraine swapped around 400 prisoners, renewing military exchanges a week after the downing of a plane that Moscow claimed was carrying detainees for transfer to Kyiv.

title: Harvard Activist Backed by Zuckerberg Makes Last Dash for Votes
description: Sam Lessin knows he’s running out of time.

title: Kosovo’s Premier Says Euro as Sole Currency Is ‘Non-Negotiable’
description: Kosovo’s premier said new rules enforcing the euro as the country’s sole currency are “non-negotiable” after the US and European Union said the regulation may disrupt payments to ethnic Serbs.

title: Scholz Slams AfD for Risking a Brexit ‘Disaster’ for Germany
description: A combative Olaf Scholz took far-right AfD lawmakers to task in a speech to parliament Wednesday, warning that their proposal for a German version of Brexit would be disastrous for Europe’s biggest economy.

title: Biden to Visit Site of East Palestine, Ohio Train Derailment
description: President Joe Biden will visit East Palestine, Ohio, after nearly a year of criticism for not seeing firsthand the impact of a train derailment that left residents fearful about air and water contamination.

title: Speaker Johnson to Allow Vote on Business, Child Tax Breaks
description: Speaker Mike Johnson will allow a vote on a $78 billion business and child tax break bill, siding with corporations over a group of Republicans who objected to the package negotiated with Senate Democrats.

title: Mexico’s Next President Will Inherit Oil Giant's $106 Billion Debt
description: Mexico’s state-owned Pemex faces most bond maturities until at least 2050

title: Taylor Swift May Be Biden’s Secret Trump Card
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Russia Approves Law to Seize Assets of Critics of War on Ukraine
description: Russian lawmakers voted to allow the state to confiscate the property of people who criticize the invasion of Ukraine, intensifying the Kremlin’s crackdown on dissent against President Vladimir Putin.

title: Trump’s Lurking Peril From Legal Cases Shows in Swing-State Poll
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Jordan Fabian highlights the results from the latest Bloomberg News/Morning Consult poll of seven key swing states . Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Biden Faces Blame for Border Crisis, Swing-State Voter Poll Shows
description: The president trails Trump in each of seven battleground states as a larger share of voters say immigration is their top issue in the 2024 election.

title: Trump Risks Losing More Than Half of Swing-State Voters If Found Guilty
description: Even more voters say they won’t support him if he’s sent to prison.

title: With Imran Khan Behind Bars, Who Will be Pakistan’s Next Leader?
description: Pakistan’s army has long exerted an influence over politics and the economy that no elected leader has successfully challenged. Imran Khan was ousted as prime minister in 2022 after falling out with the generals and losing a no-confidence vote. His imprisonment in 2023 on corruption charges prevents him from contesting a general election on Feb. 8, and the army leadership appears to favor another former premier, Nawaz Sharif, to replace him. But former cricket star Khan remains the most popular

title: Myanmar Military Extends Emergency Rule for Another Six Months
description: Myanmar’s military government on Wednesday extended the state of emergency for another six months until July 31, as army chief Min Aung Hlaing entered the fourth year as the coup leader.

title: Zelenskiy Asked Ukraine’s Top General to Quit and He Refused
description: Ukraine’s commander-in-chief refused to step down from his post at a meeting with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy Monday, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: Vietnam Politburo Accepts Member’s Offer to Step Down Amid Probe
description: Vietnam Communist Party’s Central Committee has accepted the resignation of Politburo member Tran Tuan Anh amid a probe into violations at the trade ministry under his watch.

title: EU Set to Start Red Sea Naval Mission Next Month, Borrell Says
description: The European Union’s naval operation aimed at escorting commercial ships in the Red Sea to protect them against attacks from Houthi rebels is set to begin in mid-February, according to the bloc’s foreign affairs chief.

title: What to Know About Malaysia’s Rotational Monarchy and Its Latest King
description: Malaysia’s former King Abdullah Sultan Ahmad ascended the throne only in 2019. But under the country’s unique rotational monarchy, it was soon time for him to make way for a new head of state. The country’s Conference of Rulers voted in a new king, Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar, on Oct. 27 and he was crowned on Jan. 31. Here’s what to know about Malaysia’s one-of-a-kind system.

title: Fujitsu Promises Better Quality Control After UK Post Office Scandal
description: Fujitsu Ltd. apologized for its role in the wrongful conviction of more than 900 sub-postmasters who used its accounting software, and said it will do its utmost to boost the quality of its products and regain public trust.

title: Iran Vows to Retaliate Against Any Attack as US Readies Response
description: Iran signaled it’s prepared to hit back against any US strike on its soil or assets abroad, as the White House readies a response to a drone attack that killed three American soldiers over the weekend.

title: Former Malaysia King Cuts Najib’s Jail Term to 6 Years: CNA
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak’s prison sentence has been shortened to six years from 12 years in a decision by a board led by the previous king, according to a CNA report.

title: Imran Khan Sentenced to 14 Years in Pakistan Corruption Case
description: A Pakistani court convicted former prime minister Imran Khan with a 14-year jail sentence after finding him guilty of acquiring expensive gifts from the state treasury illegally while in power.

title: Duterte Steps Up Criticism of Marcos Over Constitutional Change
description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte doubled down on his opposition to charter change, alleging that his successor Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is backing such moves to stay in power beyond the single, six-year term set in the Constitution.

title: Why China’s Xi is Pushing ‘High-Quality Development’
description: When China’s economy was finally unshackled from the world’s strictest Covid-19 controls in late 2022, hopes were high that it would roar back to help power global growth. Instead, the country has faced a confluence of problems: a property crisis, flagging exports, sluggish consumer spending and towering local government debt. The risk of a Japan-style deflationary malaise has led to an exodus of foreign capital, but President Xi Jinping has been unwilling to pull out the big stimulus guns. Some

title: Russia Is Wearing Down Ukraine's Defenses With Aid from US and EU Stalled
description: With allied assistance delayed, Kyiv’s troops don’t have enough artillery and air-defense munitions.

title: Russia Behind Spike in European GPS Jamming, Baltic General Says
description: Russia is likely behind an increase in instances of jamming satellite signals used by airlines, smartphones and weapons systems in eastern Europe, according to a senior Baltic military commander.

title: Juntas Risk Access to $702 Billion Market by Exiting Africa Bloc
description: Plans by military-ruled Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso to break away from a West African bloc have the potential to backfire on their already fragile economies and exacerbate widespread food insecurity.

title: Labour Gets Boost as Scottish Nationalists Face Covid Backlash
description: A slew of negative headlines about how Scotland’s ministers behaved in the pandemic threatens to further undermine the Scottish National Party and leader Humza Yousaf, as he tries to hold off a resurgent Labour Party looking to capitalize and ease its path to UK power at an election this year.

title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Warns ANC of Foreign Meddling in Vote
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said the nation’s case against Israel in a top United Nations court could result in foreign powers interfering with the outcomes of this year’s crucial election, where his party risks losing its majority.

title: China Shifts Key Airline Route East in Fresh Challenge to Taiwan
description: Taiwan protested China’s unilateral decision to move a commercial flight path closer to the median line in the Taiwan Strait, the latest sign of Beijing’s attempts to ramp up pressure on the democratically-ruled island following elections this month.

title: Modi’s Party Expands Control to 17 Indian States Ahead of Polls
description: India’s ruling party expanded its control to nearly two thirds of the country’s states, strengthening Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s bid to extend his decade in office in nationwide elections in coming months.

title: Billionaire Sultan Takes Malaysia Crown as Royals Gain Influence
description: The Sultan of Johor took the throne as Malaysia’s king, a role that’s become increasingly important in determining who holds power in the Southeast Asian nation.

title: China Says Trump Could Abandon Taiwan If He Wins US Election
description: China said a victory by Donald Trump in the presidential election later this year could lead to the US abandoning Taiwan, comments intended to sow doubt over Washington’s commitment to the island.

title: Jailed Imran Khan Favored in Survey to Run Pakistan’s Economy
description: Jailed ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan is the top pick for Pakistani finance professionals to oversee the cash-strapped economy’s recovery, according to a Bloomberg survey.

title: Biden Aide Urges More Talks as US Pursues De-Risking From China
description: President Joe Biden’s top national security aide promoted further communications with China — including with President Xi Jinping — while insisting the US would continue to pursue so-called de-risking measures.

title: US F-16 Jet Fighter Crashes off South Korea and Pilot Rescued
description: A US military F-16 jet fighter crashed off the west coast of South Korea and the pilot was rescued after ejecting from the aircraft, Yonhap News reported Wednesday, citing unidentified military sources.

title: Raimondo Warns Chinese EVs Pose National, Data Security Risks
description: US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo warned that Chinese-made electric vehicles pose significant national security risks, as the Biden administration weighs additional tariffs on autos from the Asian country as well as a separate measure to protect Americans’ personal information.

title: Billionaire Stan Druckenmiller Says He Will Continue to Fund Nikki Haley
description: Investor Stan Druckenmiller said he would continue to fund Nikki Haley’s increasingly long-shot challenge against Donald Trump for the Republican presidential nomination.
